Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel stay I have even experienced. Myself, and two friends went on our annual "mom's weekend away" and based on photos alone decided to stay at the Bonita Beach. We walked in the hotel through the ground floor and was quite surprised at the surroundings. To the left was a tiny counter and two large tv's monitoring the entire hotel. We were not greeted by anyone, but had to call out for someone to check us in. We had to pay up front for our entire stay. We were put in room 511, however the room did not even have a room # sign. The room was very plain, not at all like the pictures and empty. There was one bar of soap in the bathroom. No shampoo, no coffee, no dvd player. First night we waited 30 min. for someone to bring up extra pillows, keep in mind we only observed about four other in the hotel. On the second night 5-7 men were placed in the room right bedside ours, again keep in mind the hotel is empty. About 10:30 pm the men were on the balcony being very loud, we called down to the front desk and there was no answer. We ask the men to please quite down. We called the 800 # in the book to advertise and its an answering service speaking only in spanish. I called the phone number in phone book and still no answer. At midnight the men were still being very loud, sounding like they were right in our room, my friends and I got dressed and walked to the front desk after no response by phone. The front desk was empty and the front door unlocked. There was a sign taped to the front dest "Lobby will reopen at 7:00am please call # for service." Phone at desk did not work so we went to our room and called. A man answered and said he could be there in five min. to ask them to quite down. I demanded he come now and refund our money, we were leaving due to lack of security, he hung up the phone on me and never showed up. At 7:00am we were ready to leave and at front desk. The rude women behind the desk had absolutely nothing to say and would not refund our money. No one at check-in warned three women traveling alone that this facility would be unsecure and unlocked at night. I would never recommend this hotel and hope that others take the warning.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: wizegy
Reviews.Content: The place was very small, pool was filty, hallways always dirty (floors), and the manager was very very nasty . If you want a nice vacation in o.c. AVOID THIS PLACE

Reviews.Title: “You wont be disapointed”
Reviews.Author: mariac223
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a room @ the serene hotel..Nightmare. So we trecked around Ocean city @ 1am looking for a suitable hotel. Bonita beach was both affordable and quite impressive. Unless youre looking for high luxury, Bonita will do just fine. Room was immaculate, pool was nice,. If your an average person looking for a comfortable stay in a nice hotel you wont be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “A Nightmare at Bonita Beach Hotel in Ocean City, MD”
Reviews.Author: nitiforu
Reviews.Content: We initially planned to stay 7 days at the Bonita Beach Hotel in Ocean City. After 3 nights, we checked out in disgust. Our first sign of "trouble" was at check-in....the check-in desk area was a mess, and later on that day, there was a child sitting at the front desk. To get service, the child needed to call out to "grandma" to come up front to attend to the guest at the front desk. We then had to "fight" with the bathroom lights...we were told that the lights needed time to warm up, which meant that if we were in a hurry...forget it. In an attempt to locate an iron, we were told that the hotel did not have irons (not one single iron). I couldn't believe that in the USA, in this day and age, we had to deal with such issues. The bed was very uncomfortable, and overall, the room furniture was a "mess". To top it off, the hotel's management onsite (which I believe consisted of "grandma" and another female) was very rude. Be fully aware that the payment policy for this hotel is unlike that of a "regular" hotel. Once you check in, you will be charged entirely for the nights that you've reserved, regardless of whether or not you stay at the "hotel". In other words, if you hate the hotel after checking in and wanted to leave, and you had planned on staying there for 5 nights, you WILL be charged for the 5 nights (no exceptions). Also, the advertisement for the hotel mentions a kitchenette suite. Well, look for a microwave and refridgerator located right at the entrance to the room, which make the room very cramped. We actually had to go down to the front desk to get a packet of coffee, which is now a standard in most hotels. Overall, this was a nightmare!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The location to the beach was wonderful, the pool and fitness room were wonderful. The service was impecable and the rooms were very comfortable as well as having great decor. I couldn't recommend this hotel enough. I went down with some friends on a vacation and they all agreed. Don't pass up on this great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This has been one of the greatest experiences I've had with OC hotels. I have been a regular vacationer to Ocean City, and I am always looking for new places to stay to make my experience more affordable to enjoyable. Not only was the value more than worth it, but the staff was more friendly and helpful then one could ever hope for. I love going to ocean city with my kids because they really enjoy it, and it can be difficult finding a nice place for a good valie. Bonita beach came through in every way. The rooms were wonderful, the pool was great for the kids. The staff was so helpful with providing recommendations for anything we needed. I would highly recommend this as one of the top spots within the city. I have stayed in a number of other places and Bonita Beach highly exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Bonita only cares about one thing - Your Money!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JBL99
Reviews.Content: Go to their website and click on the "Features" page. It lists beds as "king" or "2 queens". We called, and the Kings were all sold out, so we asked about the 2 queens - were they REALLY queens or are they doubles? I am 6'3" tall and weigh 220 pounds, so this was a big deal - we both simply cannot fit in a double bed. We were re-assured they were QUEENS and not DOUBLES. Sure enough, when we walked in our room, they were doubles. We asked the front desk about it and were told they are queens. We then asked about switching to a king, and of course they didn't have any. No one seemed to get, or care, that had they not falsely advertised their business, we would have stayed elsewhere. They already had our money, what incentive did they have to be nice? We got very sunburnt Friday and Saturday morning, so Sat afternoon, we returned to the room for a nap around 2:30. The room was still not cleaned, which was no big deal - we'd just get towels later. At 2:45, housekeeping knocked on the door, and I told the one girl we didn't need any service today. 2 minutes later, another housekeeper comes, banging on the door like she was gonna break it down. When I opened it up, she looks at me with an attitude saying "We HAVE to clean the room". I told her "thank you but no thank you" and she simply would not accept my answer. So much for "hospitality"! Check out time is 11:00. On our day of checkout, we were 95% packed by 11:00. At 11:05, housekeeping was knocking on the door. I told them 5 more minutes and we'll be gone. No lie...at 11:07, there was a call from the front desk "kindly reminding" us about the 11:00 check out policy, and failure to comply would result in additional charges. This hospitality is amazing!! I don't know where the hell they bought their sheets for these "queen" beds, but they NEVER stayed on. EVERY time I woke up, the sheets had come off the bed, and I had been touching the bare mattress (as had my wife) at some point in my sleep. I am far from a germophobe; however, having direct skin contact with a mattress slept on by who-knows-how-many people is just a tad bit uncomfortable. Again - what is their incentive to keep their guests happy when they already have their money, right? I have no problem when things go wrong...I feel it it is how the establishment re-acts to it that defines them. The definition of the Bonita Beach Hotel should be "aloof". Book here, and you're taking a gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: trvl4fn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bonita Beach hotel last year. It was an decent value, the room was nice and we liked our mini balcony. I did find it annoying, though, that when going to/from the beach, you had to walk all the way to the front of the building (either outside, or enter on ground floor, but still had to walk all the way to the front) to get to the elevators. We were in a group with two couples, in their late 20's. It seemed like a good place for families and couples, didn't really notice any teen partying going on.

Reviews.Title: “Horribly Managed, late checkout policy changed after the fact”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My two children and I stayed Sept., Labor Day. I made reservations only 4 days in advance and spoke to young man on the phone (call was made direct to hotel, not a booking agency) and told him we were to arrive on Thursday evening and stay Friday, Saturday, Sunday nights, to check out 4 pm on Monday. I asked several times if they would allow a late check-out, 4 pm, on Monday, Labor Day, and that if there was an additional fee that I would have no problem paying the fee. And several times, this young man (sounded early 20s) said it was no problem for a 4 pm check-out, that most of their customers would be checking-out Monday morning Labor Day and the Hotel was not booked full for the rest of week, meaning they wouldn't need our room. I asked that me reservation be noted for a Monday late check-out and the young man confirmed it was noted in my reservation. Because they agreed to a Monday, 4 pm check-out is the only reason I reserved with Bonita Beach Upon arrival, a man in his late 50s, checked us in and from the way he presented himself, I took him to be the husband of a husband/wife/kids family ownership of Bonita Beach (his wife was there too and from their conversations, it was apparent they owned Bonita Beach. Oh, also upon arrival, this owner man saw me at the front desk waiting for service to be checked- in and he remained in a back room involved in a personal phone call for about 15 mins., all the while the wife was there too in the back room and did not acknowledge us or offer to assist us in checking in.) How rude. Anyway, upon finally checking in, I reminded the owner that I reserved a late check out on Monday and that I would pay any additional reasonable fee for this accommodation. He said he was not aware of this but did not indicate it would be a problem. I asked that he put that note on my file so that all staff would be aware of this. He said, "okay, fine". Labor Day Monday, morning, I go to front lobby and the wife is working the desk. She said checkout is 11:00 am. I reminded her of that upon making the reservation the young man informed me that a late check-out was okay because they were not 100% booked for the balance of the week, AND I further reminded her that upon check-in her husband did not indicate a problem with the late check out and he agreed to note my reservation and I again stated that I would pay a fee for the late checkout. We haggled for a solid 20 minutes all the while she kept stating, "we do not have a late check out", and all the while I'm reiterating that the only reason I chose to stay at Bonita Beach was that I was reassured several times during the reservation process via telephone direct to the hotel, and, at check-in that a late check-out would be no problem AND that I was amenible to any reasonable fee for a late check out. Then out of the blue, after 20 minutes of haggling/disputing/arguing, she says, "well, we will have to charge you a fee if you want to stay until 4 pm". I nearly lost it at that point. I agreed to the $50 additional cost and the kids got another afternoon on the beach. It really irked me to no end how I was treated by staff while my children watched and waited patiently. I will not return to this hotel until it is owned by someone else more amenible to customer service. BTW, Bonita Beach has their own web site and on their web site the lobby is depicted as this spacious, huge, wonderfully big lobby. And upon entering their lobby for the first time, I thought I was in the wrong hotel as the front lobby is uncomfortably small and if you have a luggage trolly full and a few people in the lobby, you will be very crammed to the point the luggage trolly becomes a major feat in order to negotiate to the elevators AND if someone is exiting the elevators with a luggage trolley while you're waiting to board, you're both in big trouble. One last note, I did have the names of everyone I spoke to: the reservation's person and the check-in man and upon haggling with the front desk woman Monday morning, I gave her the names of the persons who agreed to the late check-out and she remained totally unaffected.

Reviews.Title: “September Beach Getaway at the Bonita”
Reviews.Author: greenteanj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bonita Beach for our vacation in September. Overall, our stay was very pleasant. We stayed on the fifth floor and had a view of the ocean and the bay. The room was large with a wonderful efficiency kitchen, complete with fridge and microwave. The balcony was also oversized and included a table and two chairs. The bed was very comfortable as well. Housekeeping gave us a continuous, plentiful supply of towels and soap and were friendly. The hotel is located in a lively area, but it's not crazy like near the boardwalk. The beach is just a few steps away. The hotel pool is very nice and was unoccupied most of the time that we went to swim there. The only downsides... We had an experience with a staff member who was rude to us when we were trying to check in. She had a major attitude and obviously hated her job. All the other staff members we dealt with were very nice and courteous. The owner was friendly and we would often see him in and around the hotel. Also, the parking lot is very tight. We have a mid-size car and had a hard time parking when the lot was kind of full. If you can look past these few negatives, you will enjoy a stay at a beautiful, new hotel near the beach. Overall, we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel/great location”
Reviews.Author: lewkToronto_Ontario
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on just about every hotel in Ocean City, my husband chose the Bonita. We liked that it was new which to us meant clean with comfortable beds--and we were right. We wanted to be away from the noise and craziness of the boardwalk yet close enough to enjoy it on our terms. This hotel defintely fit the bill. We really weren't in our room accept to sleep so I can't comment on the staff but I will say that it was clean, quiet and the pool was great. The ocean was very rough when we were there so we would hang out at the beach all day (which was beautiful and close) and then go for a swim in the pool in the late afternoon. It was perfect! We would definitely stay at the Bonita again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had arrived a few hours before check-in and they allowed us to change into our bathing suits for the beach in pool changing area , and gave us a parking permit to stay parked in the lot. The hotels decorations are great, and the lobby is fascinating. Very clean, very attractive, and not even a block away from the beach. One block away from The Hobbit, accross from the hotel is Pino's Pizzaria open mostly all day for your convenience. But with the full size refridgerator, microwave, and coffee maker with plates and untensils you really don't have to be eating out unless you need to. I would definately reccomend this hotel to anyone who likes to stay in Ocean City Maryland.

Reviews.Title: “Plan to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: with reading all of the reviews for this hotel and many others, i couldnt make up my mind. so, i chose this one, unknowning what was awaiting us. i was actually pleasantly surprised. **Good points** the room is spacious and the view from the balcony was great. on the right, the bay, an on the left, the ocean! we spent a lot of time sitting on the balcony and watching the city life. it is in the middle of a lot of restaurant areas and shopping spots (81st). **Not so good points** we had to drive a way to get to the boardwalk, but figured that much from any hotel. you can actually ride the bus all day for only 2 dollars and there is a bus stop right in front of the hotel. the air conditioner is noisy (as someone else had mentioned) but if you're in the right company you wont even notice it! =) the restaruants we went to were great. for breakfast we went to the bayside skillet (twice), and the little house of pancakes. we also loved billy's sub shop, ledo's pizza, bonfire (a little pricey, but worth it), panda china buffet and rita's for dessert. all of these places were great and i highly recommend them!

HotelInfo.Name: Bonita Beach Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 8100 Coastal Highway, Ocean City, MD 21842
